page.title: 09Newton Green.
page.content: Some of the buildings in the village date back to Tudor Times including Little Gables which was an old workhouse for widows.There are now lots more houses with a population of 375 people who look after their village very well as they have won the best village in Babergh twice. The village green is a 24 acre golf course which started in 1907.If you live in Newton you can use the 9 hole course when you want and don't pay.An outsider pays 70 pounds a year for membership. The school was closed down during the war.When it reopened it became Newton's village hall which can be rented out. The church is called "All Saints".It is a Norman church down Church Lane and the vicar is shared with two other parishes.
